bug.author: ghost(ghost)
bug.summary: wandb logging does not work - log method called on the wrong object (?)
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When using the WandbLogger and not providing an experiment, I get an in line <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/deffbaba7ffb16ff57b56fe65f62df761f25fbd6/pytorch_lightning/logging/wandb.py#L84>84 of WandbLogger</denchmark-link> . Instead on , I think should be called on <denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>wandb_logger = WandbLogger(name="name", save_dir="/path/to/folder", offline=False, project="project") trainer = Trainer(logger=wandb_logger) trainer.fit(model) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.2 OS (e.g., Linux): Ubuntu 18.04 How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip Build command you used (if compiling from source): Python version: 3.7 CUDA/cuDNN version:9.0 GPU models and configuration: Any other relevant information:

comments.comment: upgrading to wandb 0.8.21 resolved this issue. was on 0.8.14 before
then we shall put the min version to requirements, pls, a PR is welcome... maybe it will be good to add requirements-extra.txt with all loggers dependencies...

Just as a means to show the users the required versions and do checks for it in the respective methods (check in wandb.py if the correct version is installed)? Guess people wouldn't want to do a pip install -r requirements-extra.txt
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Borda>@Borda</denchmark-link> yes. Created the suggested 'requierments-extra.txt' with the current versions of the logger packages
